main event: An unidentified object was observed moving in a southwesterly direction at an estimated speed of 500-600 mph over Oakland, California.
interesting points: The object was described as having a fiery orange color., The minimum observed altitude was between 2020 to 4700 ft., The object was reported to move consistently in the southwesterly direction., There are multiple potential explanations for the sighting, including it being a balloon, aircraft, astronomical event, or possibly a hoax., The sighting involved various altitude reports and weather conditions were high scattered clouds with 15 miles visibility.
witness description: information received from senior controller at Oakland Air Route Traffic Control
